metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5044 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in libgfortran might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (Fortran application crash) via vectors related to array allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

g++-mingw-w64 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-i686-posix - 16
g++-mingw-w64-i686-win32 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix - 16
g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-win32 - 16
gcc-mingw-w64 - 16
gcc-mingw-w64-base - 16
gcc-mingw-w64-i686 - 16

No subscription required

gcc-snapshot - 20140715-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> issues are in libgfortran/fortran runtime gcc-avr only builds gcc and g++ compilers/runtimes gcc-X.X-cross packages have fortran compiler/runtimes in universe gcc-XX-defaults packages do not actually include gcc, just symlinks to the default version to use per release/arch/tool gccgo packages are (surprise!) only interested in go runtimes gcc-opt is a wrapper for setting gcc arguments

criterions.comment: gcc-arm-none-eabi package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '16').
gcc-snapshot package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140715-0ubuntu1').
